newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica's Abacus lists on JSE with private placing.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica's Abacus lists on JSE with private placing.

text.p: South African group Abacus Technology Ltd said it will list on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE) on Tuesday after a successful private placing of ten million shares at 120 cents each.
Abacus, which operates in the video market, is to list in the JSE's media sector.
Since the group formed in 1991 growth has been rapid and averaged a compound rate of 55 percent a year.

"While it is unlikely that the company can sustain this rate of growth indefinitely, the increase in the size of the market it serves shows no sign of slowing in the foreseeable futrure," the firm said in its listing statement.
Abacus aims to be able to pay its first post-listing dividend for the current year ending June 30, 1997, which should equate to around 40 percent of earnings per share.
The firm is forecasting attributable income for the current financial year of 4.28 million rand, giving an earnings per share figure of 10.7 cents.
In the year to June 30, 1996, Abacus posted attributable income of 2.15 million rand and earnings per share of 7.15 cents.
